name: prochlorperazine
source: Hughes LD; Palmer DS; Nigsch F and Mitchell JBO. 2008 Why are some properties more difficult to predict than others? A study of QSPR models of solubility; melting point and LogP. J. Chem. Inf. Model. 2008. 48 (1). pp 220?397
Reason: 1,1':4',1''-Terphenyl has a melting point of 205 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for comparison is 2,6-diphenyl-2,6-dicarboxylic acid, which has a melting point of 106 degrees Celsius. The presence of two additional phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion significantly enhances the melting point due to the increase in molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100 degrees Celsius due to the presence of two additional phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion, which would notably affect the melting point.
